subject: Photography
title: Image Stabilization
description: A micro-lesson that makes Image Stabilization usable.

hook.text: Your hands shake. It's tiny, invisible, involuntary â€” and it can ruin a photo. Stabilization fights back.

buildup.text: Image stabilization compensates for hand movement by shifting lens elements or the sensor in real time.

discovery.text: Gyroscopic sensors detect motion hundreds of times per second. Counter-movements cancel out the shake.

twist.text: Stabilization helps with slow shutter speeds but can't freeze moving subjects. It steadies the camera, not the world.

climax.text: Modern systems offer up to seven stops of correction â€” letting you shoot handheld in near darkness.

punchline.text: The camera shakes. Then it unshakes itself.

quiz.question: What does image stabilization compensate for?
